page.title: 11Bocking Seventy Years Ago
page.content: {Miss Dorothy Johnson}has lived in{Bocking}all her life. When she was 3 or 4 she went to Sunday School, which was held at the village primary school.{Miss Johnson}went to{Bocking {Church School}and she learnt maths, geography, English and history. The boys did gardening and the girls did knitting. When she was twelve she went to a{Braintree}school which opened in the 1920's and closed about 15 years later. Most children walked or cycled to school because there were no buses. Most of the shopping was done in {Bocking,}where there was a variety of shops. Occasional journeys were made to{Colchester}for special items. Clothes were often made at home or by a local dressmaker. Visits to her Grandad, meant walking to{Halstead}and then a further 6 six miles on.
